amendment.description: To create a point of order against legislation that defunds essential services for children, families, and seniors, including programs that feed hungry seniors like Meals on Wheels, Head Start and other child care assistance that allows parents to work and pay their bills, and programs that keep children safe from abuse and neglect, to give massive tax cuts to billionaires.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1661 not agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 1661 proposed by Senator Welch to Amendment SA 1717. To create a point of order against legislation that defunds essential services for children, families, and seniors, including programs that feed hungry seniors like Meals on Wheels, Head Start and other child care assistance that allows parents to work and pay their bills, and programs that keep children safe from abuse and neglect, to give massive tax cuts to billionaires.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1661 proposed by Senator Welch to Amendment SA 1717.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 1661 not agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
